 AudioPathManager ()

Detailed Description

This is the audio path manager dealing with uplink/downlink path control This is a singleton - use GetInstance().

The MMI will have 100% freedom to setup any kind of combination for the Uplink and Downlink audio path.

All combinations of path∆s can be configured, but the following combinations will result in a HW conflict:
Uplink: None of the paths UplinkPathHandsetMic, UplinkPathHeadsetMic, UplinkPathI2S1_Rx (bluetooth) and UplinkPathTTY can be enabled in parallel.
Downlink: 1. DownlinkPathMonoHeadset and DownlinkPathStereoHeadset cannot be enabled in parallel.
2. DownlinkPathTTY cannot run in parallel with any of the downlink paths.
All other combinations are allowed.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN AudioPathManager::AddAudioPath (  AudioPath &  path  ) 
 

Activate the path. Use RemoveAudioPath(AudioPath& path) to deactivate the path. The path will be active besides the already active paths.

Parameters:
path The path to be activated
Returns:
FALSE if the path is already active or cannot be activated due to a resource conflict
Note:
On EGOLD platforms it is not possible to have more than one active paths at the same time so the function will return FALSE if there is already an active path. Use RemoveAllAudioPaths() before calling this function or call AudioDeviceManager::LinkAccessory() that will do all for you.

BOOLEAN AudioPathManager::CanLinkAudioPath (  AudioPath &  path  ) 
 

Check if there is a conflict beetwen the specified audio path and the current activated paths enabled using AddAudioPath(AudioPath& path)

Parameters:
path The path to be checked
Returns:
TRUE if the path can be linked

BOOLEAN AudioPathManager::Enable3dSound (  BOOLEAN  enable = TRUE  ) 
 

Enables "3D enhanced stereo" of the downlink audio paths. Supported downlink paths are stereo headset and stereo backspeaker.

Parameters:
enable TRUE - enable the 3D mode, FALSE - disable the 3D mode
Returns:
TRUE - if succeded and hardware supports this feature, otherwise FALSE

void AudioPathManager::EnableUplinkAudioPaths (  BOOLEAN  enable = TRUE  ) 
 

Enables the uplink audio paths. Uplink paths are only needed when there is a call or when a sound is being recorded. If the uplink path is enabled in some other case, there is a background noise. So the uplink paths are only going to be enabled when really needed.

Parameters:
enable TRUE - enable the uplink audio paths, FALSE - disable the uplink audio paths

BOOLEAN  downLink = TRUE
) 
 

Remove all the audio path linuplink/downlink paths

Parameters:

Returns:
